item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. "A Course of Pure Mathematics" – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (100 points | 19 comments)
2. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (169 points | 116 comments)
3. I Wrote a Game Boy Advance Game in Zig (42 points | 9 comments)
4. Beyond Gradient Averaging in Parallel Optimization (38 points | 7 comments)
5. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (49 points | 9 comments)
6. Coding Font Selection 'Tournament' (50 points | 37 comments)
7. I made a tiny library for switches and sum types in Lua (10 points | discuss)
8. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (131 points | 21 comments)
9. Lightstorm: Minimalistic Ruby Compiler (11 points | discuss)
10. LineageOS 22 Released (24 points | 4 comments)
11. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (756 points | 66 comments)
12. Cook: Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (11 points | 3 comments)
13. Curl-Impersonate (360 points | 90 comments)
14. The Homa Network Protocol (58 points | 12 comments)
15. Execution units are often pipelined (140 points | 70 comments)
16. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (159 points | 76 comments)
17. RubyConf 2024: Cloud Native Buildpack Hackday (and other Ruby deploy tools, too) (40 points | 5 comments)
18. 'Obelisks': New Class of Life Has Been Found in Human Digestive System (318 points | 107 comments)
19. How Well Do LLMs Generate Code for Different Application Domains? (46 points | 9 comments)
20. China to Build Thorium Molten-Salt Reactor in 2025 (64 points | 15 comments)
21. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps, and I can't stop (4 points | discuss)
22. Ts_zip: Text Compression Using Large Language Models (102 points | 36 comments)
23. Behind the Scenes: Alien Worlds – Jumpship over a tidally locked planet (14 points | 1 comment)
24. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (165 points | 52 comments)
25. Ask HN: TLS 1.3 and Post-Quantum Encryption for HN? (5 points | 1 comment)
26. Beyond BLE: Cracking Open the Black-Box of RF Microcontrollers [video] (94 points | 13 comments)
27. Database mocks are not worth it (106 points | 145 comments)
28. Performance of LLMs on Advent of Code 2024 (30 points | 21 comments)
29. Pincites (YC S23) is hiring a founding engineer to build legal AI agents (Remote) ( | hide)
30. Fun facts about SQLite (298 points | 122 comments)
